Thank you Rica, that is great.

Have a lovely weekend

Jo

Hi Chris, 

Confirming we have now made the updates and they are ready for you to review. 

Here is the link: 
https://transplant.org.au/light-a-life-gala-dinner/

Please let us know if you would like any further changes.

full_threads.body:
Hi @ricaR here are the updates for Light a Life Gala Dinner 2025 Page

(Time: 30mins)

full_threads.body:
Hi team,

Recorded video walkthrough here:
https://www.loom.com/share/896fe07674054d8086c33da4f21625f2

Content below and images attached.

This needs to be done by 12pm Freiday (let me know if not done and I can do
directly).

Thank you
Andy

Andy,



That will be fine. I threw a few more pics in if you can add them brilliant.



Thanks for coming back tonight.



chris



From: Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au>
Sent: Thursday, 10 April 2025 10:25 PM
To: Chris Thomas <chris.thomas@transplant.org.au>
Cc: Jo O'Farrell <jo.ofarrell@transplant.org.au>; Heath Maguire <
heath.maguire@wolfiq.com.au>
Subject: Re: FW: Light a Life update



Hi Chris,



Jumping in here as Heath is out of office today.



Thanks for the context and we'll try and get this to the front of the queue
with the team tomorrow morning.



Just to confirm layout - it will be something like this?

https://transplant.org.au/walk-to-end-the-wait/



Thanks,

Andy



On Thu, Apr 10, 2025 at 9:04 PM Chris Thomas <chris.thomas@transplant.org.au>
wrote:

Heath,



Hope you are well?


First the good news. We have a young marcomms person joining us next week
and we might ask you to help bring them up to speed on the wordpress site.



Now, need your help quickly in the morning if you don’t mind? We have a 2pm
meeting where this would hopefully be published.



We need a new page under About Us/Events called Light a Life Gala Dinner



The header image could come from the attached front page.



We did make an attempt but got confused in the Appearance Section.



The heading on the page would be:



*Your Invitation to the Light a Life Gala Dinner, May 2025*



Sub-heading



*A Body Buddies Fundraiser for Transplant Australia*



Copy:



Join us for an unforgettable evening of elegance, inspiration, and
philanthropy at the Light a Life Gala Dinner hosted by Body Buddies in
support of Transplant Australia.



To be held on May 24, 2025, at the Ultima Function Centre, Keilor Park,
Melbourne, the Gala promises to be a wonderful night raising vital funds to
promote organ and tissue donation.



Building on the success of its 2024 Fundraising Gala, Body Buddies is
partnering with Transplant Australia to host the 2025 Fundraising Gala,
focusing on multicultural awareness for organ donation. This initiative
addresses the critical need to improve organ donor sign-up rates among
Australia’s multicultural communities, which historically have lower
registration rates due to misinformation, cultural misconceptions, and
limited awareness about organ donation.



About Body Buddies



Body Buddies is an Australian soft toy company created by award winning
24-year-old entrepreneur, Aayushi Khillan. Body Buddies sell plushies,
keychains, stickers and other accessories in the shapes of adorable organ
characters. Over the past 4 years, it has garnered international fame. On
social media, it has accumulated over 36,000 followers and has raised over
$150,000 for charity. Body Buddies has made over 3000 plushie sales and has
won several awards. It won the 7News Young Achievers Award 2022 in the
Healthy Living Category. It has also received the Australia

Post Local Heroes and International Diana Award 2024 by the Royal Family.



Details:

Date: May 24, 2025

Venue: Ultima Function Centre, Keilor Park, VIC 3036

Dress Code: Black Tie & Cultural Wear

Time: 6pm-11pm



Attached are some photos to liven up the page.



The link for booking is:



https://events.humanitix.com/light-a-life-body-buddies-fundraiser-for-transplant-australia





Jo will be available in the morning for any queries.



Thanks



Chris





From: Jo O'Farrell <jo.ofarrell@transplant.org.au>
Sent: Thursday, 10 April 2025 7:32 PM
To: Chris Thomas <chris.thomas@transplant.org.au>
Subject: FW: Light a Life update







From: Aayushi K <akhillan009@gmail.com>
Sent: Saturday, 1 March 2025 8:21 AM
To: Jo O'Farrell <jo.ofarrell@transplant.org.au>
Cc: Chris Thomas <chris.thomas@transplant.org.au>; rohitkakanoor@gmail.com
Subject: Re: Light a Life update



*Invitations*

Thanks for copying us into invitations to DonateLife/OTA. When you have a
moment, please can you share a google docs on who has been invited so far
including Ministers?

* - Richard Marles*

*- Natalie Suleyman*

*- Ben Caroll*

*- Anthony Carbines*

*- Sam Rae*

*- Jana Stewart*

*- Anthony Cianflone *

*- Ella George*

*- Belinda Wilson *

*- Ingrid Stitt*

*- Mary-Anna THomas*

*- Jaclyn Symes*

*- Danny Pearson*

*- Lily D'Ambrosio*



*Note: not all have been asked to speak, but invited as VIP guests. Goal is
to invite around 30 and maybe 10-15 come :)*



*Partner recognition.*

We discussed how Transplant Australia could recognise the key Partner
supporting the Transplant Voices project. Please can we sign off on the
proposal including the $ ask. Here is a brief outline and happy to discuss
further.



*Transplant Australia will collaborate with Body Buddies and the Partner to
support all promotional, advocacy and networking opportunities.*

*Transplant Australia will recognise the Foundation Partner for the 2 years
of the Transplant Voices project including:*

· *Acknowledgment in announcements, media releases and web news article
about the project*

· *Inclusion of Partner logo and live weblink from relevant project page
on Transplant Australia website*

· *A dedicated social media post recognising the Partner support of the
project*

· *Opportunities for signage and promotional recognition at associated
events.*



In terms of general recognition of Light a Life event sponsors , we can do
a dedicated web news article and social media post about the event
recognising Body Buddies and all the event partners together.

*This is great, we will ensure we use this information when advertising the
project partnership. Not sure if we will be able to secure one but we are
trying our best :) I have attached the prospectus we wrote up as well.*



*Webpage*

I am drafting this. If you have preferred images/assets from last year,
please send through.

*No preferred images, you can use as you like! I believe you should have
the link to all the photos?*



*Logo*

Resending the logo variations sent end of last year. Let me know your
thoughts.

*I like this one personally, we can use it if you send me a higher quality
version?*



*Running Order*

Thank you for sharing the draft running order. Great to get started on that
- and no doubt this will continue to evolve many times 😉, Its pretty full
with speeches and activities and it would be good if we can make sure there
is some quiet downtime blocks for table guests to chat during mealtime – eg
10 mins over entrée and 15-20 mins over dinner, rather than wait until
after dessert.

A couple of suggestions:

· Rather than invite the platinum sponsors to give standalone
speeches, could you invite 3 platinum sponsors up on stage together. MC can
host a Q& A about what their business achievements, why they are supporting
the program, highlight their community investment, or commitment to
community wellbeing, multicultural inclusion etc – 6 minutes in total.
This could be more engaging for the audience.

· *Again this all depends on who our final sponsors are, but
definitely can chat about it. Q&A gets messy as I have realised from last
year though, no one listens.*

· Just an idea and it may not work, but could one of the
entertainment pieces be staged on arrival or during the entry to the
ballroom perhaps? Or perhaps some of the entertainment kicks on the
dancefloor later in the night? Just thoughts.

· *Does not really work for our culture since people arrive late.
It will be a waste of money having entertainment right at the start, plus
you want to knock off some key points & presentations before people start
to lose concentration. *

· We are working on video ideas and think we will try and capture
some of the multicultural donor/recipient stories in the video, so maybe
the in-person speeches can be shortened to 5 mins. We can work on that.

· *Sure, happy to see how the video develops and go off of that*



*Talent*

· We were following up with an Indian recipient family who would
have been ideal but unfortunately they advised us yesterday that they are
having a difficult time at present and unable to commit. So will keep
working on this

· I will also give Alanna at Donate Life a call directly about this
directly if that is OK?

· *Yep, doesn't have to be an indian family, can be any culture.
But I have been in chats with Pheobe and Alanna, maybe if you both could
pursue from your end please?*

· We are working on video concepts that could deliver a lot of this
messaging.

· *Yes but I still think we need physical presence. A video by
itself won't give enough impact, though it will certainly complement it.*



*Pre-Sponsors Event*

Please let us know as soon as you have a date. 16th May is our preference
if possible. We are needing to lock in other travel and meetings.

*We are unable to do 16th of May as the venue is booked. The optimal date
for now is looking to be May 3rd on Saturday evening. ALthough, we are
still confirming with the venue that this is ok. But it looks like the most
promising date unfortunately. *



Updates from our end:

- Invites sent to Ministers listed above. Natalie Suleyman and Ben
Carroll are confirmed.
- Entertainments locked in
- We are working on raffles & auction prizes.
- Emailed Donatelife regarding getting some multicultural stories - if
you can follow up on your end
- Working on finalising who to contact as sponsors/table listing

Requests for TA:

- Can you let your TA Vic team know too, so they can plan in advance and
hopefully more can be in attendance this year!

[image: Image removed by sender. created with MySignature.io]
<https://mysignature.io/?utm_source=logo>

Aayushi Khillan

Founder of Body Buddies | MD-PhD Student

m: 0424714514

w: www.linkedin.com/in/aayushi-khillan

e: akhillan009@gmail.com



[image: Image removed by sender.]
<https://mysignature.io/editor/?utm_source=freepixel>







On Fri, Feb 28, 2025 at 6:10 PM Jo O'Farrell <jo.ofarrell@transplant.org.au>
wrote:

Hi Aayushi



Sorry to have missed you today. Hope all is well.

this

messaging.



*Pre-Sponsors Event*

Please let us know as soon as you have a date. 16th May is our preference
if possible. We are needing to lock in other travel and meetings.



Look forward to catching up in a couple of weeks, but feel free to
email/call as needed.



Have a lovely weekend.



Best wishes



Jo
